answers.answer: Yikes, If you can't get the swelling to go down I personally would have already called my doctor. I don't know what your feet looked like before but your ankle alone looks like you rolled it.  Have you been having blood pressure issues?

as far as I know I haven't had bp issues.. but I have thin feet. this is the biggest they've ever been before.. other than earlier when the veins were sticking out. the top of my foot itches and  it looks like a lotta fluid is just sitting on there. I had my feet up for an hour and it's still puffy.

If I were you, I would call my OB/midwife. It's normal to have swelling in the hands and feet while pregnant, but that to me, looks pretty extreme. Especially if you've been trying to stay off of them. Have you noticed if your face is swelling any? Is one foot/ankle swollen more than the other? That's usually a dead giveaway for preeclampsia.It could be something totally normal for you, but I'd still err on the cautious side and get it checked out.In the meantime try laying on your left side.

If it's just your hands and feet then put your feet up OVER your heart, drink lots of water, lay on your left side. Then you can call your ob tomorrow, but if your face starts to swell call your ob ASAP.I just went through a crazy swelling scare this week so the info was fresh in my mind. Hope this helps. Oh and it seems silly, but the more water you drink the more it will go down.
Keep us updated, hope it isn't anything serious.

Okay, I am not here to scare you but feel I need to share my story.  I too had swelling like this.  It was so bad, my mother cried when she saw my feet, the only shoes that fit me was the shower shoes that are basically velcro slip ons.  My feet took the most punishment.  I called the OB numerous times, she seen it numerous times and they told me it was normal.  Then came d day and when I went into the hospital I had protein in my urine and tada, I had preclampsia.  My blood pressure was high as well which it was high for a couple of weeks before I went into labor as well.  So.....I guess my point is, don't freak out, this might be the start of preclampsia but you are far enough along I wouldn't worry about it.  Just make sure you ask your doctor how much of a risk is preclampsia to you the next time you get your urine checked and your blood pressure done, plus have the OB look at your feet.

I have had pretty bad swelling in most of my pregnancies (6 full term)  I have been checked for the protien and the BP issues. I have NEVER had any of that.  I just swell. It's always my feet/legs and hands.  I agree with NicMom...lay down and relax. Prop your feet up, lay on your left side and take it easy. Drink a lot of water.  Lack of water can cause swelling to get out of hand during pregnancy.  Stay AWAY from salt and caffiene.  I know caffiene is a diuretic but too much can have the opposite affect.  If you notice any facial swelling or numbness, don't call, just go straight to L & D.  Otherwise, call your ob in the morning and ask if you can have them look at it just for peace of mind.Btw, I've had swelling WORSE than yours.  To the point where I almost couldn't walk because my legs were so heavy and fat. After my 2nd full term pregnancy I was put on diuretics and I literally lost almost 30 lbs of water weight my first two weeks postpartum.

One foot is bigger than the other. I didn't even notice that cause of the swelling. That's what I was focused on. I did have some numbness in my foot and some itching. And some what looks like I have little tiny purple spots. My right hand is swollen more than my left.I had been lying on my side and in the bed for a while. I'd say about an hour or more and the swelling went down a little after DH rubbed my feet.  But the second I got up to go to the bathroom, it went back up. Should I just go ahead and go?
Call your on call dr or labor and delivery they will be able to help you figure out what to do.  Good luck and let us know.
I'm about to call. I will let you all know soon as I figure something out lol :)

I  get bad swelling as well. I woyuld watch the salt and sodium intake and keep your feet elevated!! I hope it is nothing serious and I wish you a happy healthy pregnancy and baby :) But check your blood preassure aswell !

Hope everything went well with the doctors.In my prenatal class a lady was complaining ab out her her swelling and showed me her feet.. and they looked similar to yours...  She couldnt understand how I was still wearing shoes... I just said everyone is different I have yet to swell yet and I am couple weeks behind you...My cousin was just diagnosed with Preeclampsia and had to be induced at 35 weeks..  She had no idea...  Just one day, she started swelling really bad and when she went to the hospital her BP had spiked ...  The baby was born healthy, only 5lbs.. but he was breathing on his own, he was released from the hospital in about a week.

my feet are probably a size or so bigger, They have became more swelled now that im at the end, I see the doctor everyweek now so last week they  took blood and now Im doing a 24 hr urine test today to see if i have the early stages of preeclampsia, I wont now until tues or wed, my bp was a little on highside, but they werent sure, Do u have protein in your urine? I also had serve swelling with my other two, so this could just be u, but I would check to see just incase
Yes I always have protein in my urine i always have to do those stooooopid24 hour urine test yuck! lol

question: I know that swelling in pregnancy is normal toward the end. But what I don't know is when is the swelling bad enough to call the doctor? My feet and hands have been swelling off and on all day. So I'm not sure when I should be calling the doctor. Even with my feet up, they are still a little puffy. What would you do about this? I'm 35w1d.
title: Swelling - please view
